sentence.text: She had taken off her dress and slip and hung them on the branch of a tree .
Anna had taken off her blouse and was waiting for Liz to notice her shoulder .
Ruth took off the cloak , shivering -- though , if anything , the sun seemed to reach her more warmly now .
I took off my cloak and immediately began to thread the fabric through the hole .
Lyn took off her coat and came back to where her desk and typewriter and appointments book were .
I took off my coat quickly and tossed it on the chair in front of my desk .
I went in as usual , took off my greatcoat and tunic and tie and made some small pancakes and dipped them in boiling fat -- used to take me a quarter of an hour every night .
Markby , taking off his overcoat and sticking it haphazardly over a peg , grunted .
He took off his overcoat and sat down at his desk , staring at the man .
Maxim took off his silk scarf , wiped his brow and put the scarf in his pocket .
Isobel Thompson took off her scarf and ruffled her grey curls .
Morrissey is always taking off his shirt but he is also proudly and publicly chaste .
When Clark took off his shirt he had black-and-blue bruises over his shoulders and arm .
He took off his jacket and tossed it across a wooden bench by the fire .
He slowly took off his clothes and the smell of the night with them , and stood there naked in the morning light by his bedroom window , and he smiled .
Therefore to make sure of this important condition he took off his trousers and sat down on the seed-bed , thus testing the warmth of Mother Earth through the most sensitive part of his anatomy .
By two , most children can take off hats , shoes , socks , pants and vests , but they have trouble with sleeves , fastenings and bulky jackets because chubby hands are clumsy and uncoordinated .
` Nobody seems to know what happened , but one day during a concert she suddenly stood up , took off her knickers and showed everyone her bottom .
An elderly lady who had once asked Franz Liszt for his autograph , felt quite faint as Fred took off his kilt and reached for the laces of his boots .
When he felt brave enough he took off the old pullover and the tracksuit pants that he 'd been sleeping in and started to dress .
He 'd had time to wash his hands and take off his rubber gloves and apron .
She took off her apron and went upstairs from the basement to suggest the extravagance to Irena .
She took off her underclothes -- bending , high-stepping -- eyes on some distant thought .
She shivered , without knowing why , and he took off his tunic and wrapped it around her shoulders .
Rose , as she listened to Lonie 's questions , took off her black cardigan , rolled up her black sleeves .
Emily took off her cape feeling she had found an ally .
Nicola Reynolds : above him , she took off a glove and ran a hand through his hair .
She was taking off her gloves as she approached .
Bill Smith took off his battered trilby and scratched his fuzzy ginger hair as he sat on his cart and urged the horse forward .
Hamish took off his war bonnet and scratched his head .
There was a chill wind on the Hill of the Dead , but Biff took off his top-hat and mopped his forehead with a red spotted handkerchief .
Slowly I took off my wedding dress and veil .
She had not taken off the headdress .
Finally , sensing that we were on a loser and not keen on the mile-long trek back to the crossing point , I took off boots and socks and walked into the fast-flowing stream .
He took off his boots and did this monologue about suede .

The reaching was straightforward enough : at the first river we took off our boots , rolled up our trousers to mid-thigh and , dividing about thirty kilograms of photographic and emergency equipment between us , waded across .
Pilgrims take off their shoes and walk from the slipper chapel into Walsingham to the Anglican site .
Kalchu took off his shoes and went into the shrine .
The man took off his spectacles and wiped them on a snowy white handkerchief .
I took off my watch and placed it in front of me .
She had taken off the ribbon that kept back her hair and it hung about her shoulders , much longer than Seb had realised .
Frank took off his glasses and began to polish them in the sheet with enthusiasm .
He took off the phoney glasses and tweed hat and threw them to one side .
Thomas , sitting in a deep armchair in front of an open fire , was browsing through the newspaper and he took off his reading glasses to look her over .
I take off my woolly hat and try it on .
He took off his hard hat and wiped his brow , after checking for scaffolding .
Mitch took off his helmet .
When he took off his dented helmet he proved to have bristly fair hair above a snub-nosed face .
We took off our crowns and swords and cloth of gold and moved silent on the road to Elsinore .

I took off the yellow waistcoat with its white lining and hung it on a hanger , and I took off my shoes , but rather like George I still felt myself to be on duty , so I switched off the light and lay on top of the bedclothes watching the black Canadian land slide by , while the free northern show went on above for hours in the sky .
I took off my rings and jewellery and put them in my handbag then lowered myself over the cliff edge .
Here he took off the pendulous wig , wiped his face on the yellowing lace handkerchief dripping out of the over-ornate and antique jacket and revealed himself as a young man .
The judge , Lord Morison , and both Crown and defence counsel took off their wigs and gowns before the girl appeared on screen from another room in the building .
Then he took off his mask , and I saw his face . "
Flora had taken off her frock and stood with her back to Cosmo and Hubert , dressed only in knickers .
Salt was making a meal of Jess 's shortcomings and Nancy stared at the new kitchen wench while her mother nodded in her easy-going way as she took off her shawl and recaptured her dropping hairpins .
She was taking off her chocolate sweater and was all twisted up , a rather thin but nicely made young girl with a delicate , withdrawn face , against a wall of dark red roses .
I was over-qualified and signing on and I realised there was more money to be made taking my clothes off . .
You took your clothes off for it .
If I 'd had my hat I 'd have taken it off to the guy .
As he took it off he remembered the sausage and treacle tart in his pocket .
If the first two rows started barfing when I took my shirt off , I would n't do it again
When you take your clothes off you are taking off your identity .
` Take your shoe off and stand on the towel . "
Well take it off then !
I 'm not offering to help you take your dress off . "
Jan starts hers at four , for which I take my hat off to her .
` So can I take the shoes off , Nana ? "
